hxlxyCOW0E_7KR9g7rpxGw.text: Cereal killer cafe is super overrated. I was greeted by an unwelcoming "you have to wait 20 Minutes, there are no seats right now". We can back and went downstairs to an obnoxiously lit basement room with tables of empty cereal bowls. We went back up to order our food and the cashier was extremely short with us, especially when I asked for a receipt. She told me that I had to wait for her to help other customers (even though the line was not that long). Then we got our cereal, which was good but how hard is it to pour cereal in a bowl and cut up some bananas. Then the "maltshakes"... it was so bad, a friend and I were splitting it and we couldn't even finish it. It was essentially lukewarm peanut butter milk soup. I went up to see if we could get something and I explained that it was not good and she just looked at me and said "ok". We left unsatisfied and angry. It was kitschy and cute, but definitely not worth the trip.

wOxNjQcErrdyjy0E51zU1g.text: Popped in for breakfast on Sunday morning. We were really lucky as we ordered and sat down just as a rush of people came in.The cafe is a little overwhelming as there are cereal boxes all over the walls. I was so excited I could barely read the menu. After what felt like an eternity I picked Reese's Puffs as I'm obsessed with Reese's Pieces and anything peanut butter flavour. The milk selection is very impressive, I was very conservative and had semi-skimmed milk. We managed to get a table upstairs but it's tight when there's a queue. There's seating down stairs but I have no idea if it's more spacious.I really like it here and I don't care if everything I like will rot my teeth!

QGPyKcmnu_2tCbbQbjZkjQ.text: I wouldn't go everyday but I am glad that I've been. I would take people who never been before to check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Strawberries and banana toppings !
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. My favourite cereal Froot Loops

Ggu4HsWgWZ8eLRbYlrPXEQ.text: A hipster joint through and through, but interesting and worth a visit. It's located in an eclectic neighborhood which alone is worth a visit. In all my trips to London I'd never been anywhere near this area...Wow.  Anyway, Cereal Killer itself was very interesting, and for a restaurant based solely on cereal, man it was packed. The staff worked hard though and the line moved quickly. The space is tight, but there's additional seating downstairs. The custom creations, like Unicorn Poop, are very well thought out and taste great.  They also have tons of add-ins like flavored milks and various fruits. If you're considering this place, then you obviously understand it's not for the diabetic. The sugar content in most concoctions is through the roof! That aside, Cereal is definitely worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Unicorn Poop!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Interior on a busy lunch rush.
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Exterior, very easy to miss if you're not looking for it.

_PCSTGUJd_rDG2pypm-G7w.text: Such a cool, hippy and chilled cafe! A cafe that has cereal from all over the world? Why wouldn't you love it! It is really all about the experience.. choose a cereal you have never had, have it with a jug of flavored milk and DEFIANTLY have a poptart!  I had a cereal cocktail with vanilla milk, and of course a smore pop tart! To say I was on a sugar rush by the end is an understatement! Let your inner child freeeeee :)

wqDuH04JdARJgmnztORGGQ.text: This place has the biggest selection of cereals I've ever seen. Literally any cereal you ate while you were a  child is here for you to enjoy! Absolutely loved it and would recommend to anyone who enjoys cereals or who is simply looking for a delicious treat any time of day.

R0m2l78x6O2abJnwmdzVsA.text: I was there when the grand opening and it was really crowded. But i waited not more than 30 minutes. I recommend you to try the rare one because they have all cereal around the world! The place is small though, but it was quite a unique cafe

VOjfRPm5qoevpx0MT7Xzeg.text: Perfect. Spent the weekend in London and my happiest moment was eating a bowl in this lovely place. I had Krave with chocolate chips, banana, hazelnut milk and a happy hippo, and it was fantastic. I couldn't imagine a cooler atmosphere or friendlier staff. It made me wonder why there aren't more of these (New York location?). Would go again.

HK-4diQGOytt84M1ry1SJw.text: The idea for the cafe is really great and the staff is incredibly friendly. They helped explain how the cafe worked and were helpful in giving ideas about different combinations. However it was very slow moving and took a lot longer than anticipated. It is also pretty expensive considering you are just getting cereal, but I guess you're paying for the experience! Definitely a lot of tourists but a nice unique stop if you're in the area.

v0BiaHF9hUNrLJl0QMuxHA.text: A very clever and unique place to eat. Definitely worth a visit even though you pay a lot more for one bowl of cereal than you would buying a box at the store. I tried the Double Rainbow which had Fruity Cheerios (a substitution for Trix), Fruity Pebbles, freeze dried marshmallows, and strawberry milk. I would absolutely recommend it. My friend had the Chocopotomus but they were out of the hippos so they put crushed oreos on instead. It was a nice taste of home for an American living in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Outside window of Cereal Killer Cafe
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Downstairs dining at Cereal Killer Cafe.
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Double Rainbow (left), Chocopotamus (right) with oreos instead of the Kinder hippo

HSln7I2J2wYtF6NeeH_hhg.text: Difficult to find because these was no sign outside, had to call the store for directions. Once we finally found it it was as good as we'd hoped, lots of variety (different fruit toppings as well as different flavors of milk) and nice folks behind the counter. Fun atmosphere all around, would really recommend to anyone with a sweet tooth or to those who are still kids at heart.

nPFu321rmKx1tfk4hkII6Q.text: Yes, you're effectively paying for one of the most simple things you can do in your own home, but this place is so retro, they have all old cereal boxes on the walls, and wall of cereal killers, made out of cereal!  They have a HUGE amount of different cereals (English and American) they even have different flavors of milk! Can get quite busy, and if there is line, dont worry, ity goes down quick! grab your bowl and go down stairs! they have cartoons playin on the tv's and glow in the dark bowls. And so cheap too, always a bonus!

6yY7gLsGOstGX06Iq3SYhw.text: Absolutely love it.I'm a massive sweet-tooth kind of girl and this is my heaven.It very easily could be the most expensive bowl of cereal you will ever eat - until you go back, which you will - but it is totally worth every penny!

y2oABQEKM9j2F76Gnvudzw.text: Definitely overhyped. I thought this was a cool concept but spending ₤9 ($15) for two bowels of cereal that i can make at home is a little ridiculous. The cereal was mediocre (i mean, its cereal), the milk is just overpriced milk with food coloring.. as for the place its self it was super hard to find and was extremely packed we had to stand around waiting for a seat. Definitely don't reccomend, we left feeling like we wasted time and money.

X6K8GA1OAWEoRvGavVR35g.text: So the hype of this is well known, Two Irish Brothers, with beards, on Brick Lane, serving all kinds of cereal- what's not to love? Hipsters form an orderly queue right? Well the initial impact when you walk in has the desired effect. Colourful cereal boxes on the shelves, showing us the funky favourites and the cute character cereals that remind you of your childhood. Every cartoon character you could think of on a cereal box, art work made from cheerios and cereal themed merchandise. The Place is small and the service was a little slow considering they only have to pour cereal into a bowl, but the "cocktails" are a fun way to get a sugar rush-Lucky charms, golden nuggets, twinkie and your choice of milk all in one bowl!The decor is really well done with all kinds of toys found in cereal boxes and 90's tv shows, the Fun factor has been the focus here.There is no shortage on choice, any cereal from peanut butter crunch to healthy granola, real milk, strawberry, soya, hazelnut...RED VELVET POPTARTS!I really appreciated that they served your choice of milk in a little class bottle rather than just pouring it on to your cereal, then you didn't have to have soggy cereal- a major bonus!All good things aside...Let's be honest... £5 for cereal is pushing it but it wouldn't be a regular thing, this is a place to go once in a while with friends, maybe take a friend visiting there and hit brick lane at the same time. I definitely won't be rushing over there when I get a craving for cereal, but for a fun thing to show visitors it does the job.

nqi2dIA2hpZYjLnVZoDvOg.text: Loved my experience here, but I think the novelty of the place will wear off in a few years I think. Decor is awesome, very instagram worthy. Colorful, filled with cereal boxes, quirky. Service was quite slow though. You can either choose a cereal, milk, and toppings or choose one of their cereal "cocktails", which basically means a mash up of their own creation. I went with the chocopotamous for £4.75. I forget exactly but chocolate with a side of milk. A yummy treat since I haven't eaten cereal in a while but I wouldn't necessarily make my way here again. Fun to visit and a "must try once in your life" but it's just cereal in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chocopotamous cereal cocktail
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Counter

OwO9p9aRxkMZXVYPUzd1dQ.text: I know that people might think this cafe is overrated, but I can assure you, it's not!!  I really enjoy going here.  When I heard that London was getting a cereal bar, I thought "how weird".  But then I went, and thought it was genius.  Where else can you find your favorite cereal?  Cereal Killer Cafe offers cereal from all around the world in addition to pop tarts and really wacky toppings like crushed Oreo cookies and marshmallow fluff.  They also have all kinds of milk, including almond milk for those super healthy/lactose challenged customers.  I'm afraid I am boring and predictable, as I order the same thing: Captain Crunch with skim milk.  I always get a large bowl - it doesn't make sense to get anything less!!  Also, you can mix and match cereals and go crazy!  The prices are a little high, but you go for the experience and the cereal selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Some of the many selections here at the cereal cafe

3DqiQF7DrCslTsWn8U5ifw.text: Double rainbow and unicorn poop! What could be better than a cereal cocktail for breakfast?! (Or lunch or dinner)..Fantastic staff, amazing decorating and use of space in this original gem located in an equally cool area! Who knew there was Prince Will and Kate cereal on the market?

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Delicious! So many flavours so little time!

G4cR_MVIUMZGkz-iiSLYJA.text: Such a cool concept! Love the decor, and all the cereal possibilities. A fun novelty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Unicorn poop!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Ordering at the counter
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

yMR9PrP8BNiFstOmsuVR4A.text: I came here with friends after accidentally walking past it and into the chocolate shop next door. We went up to the counter to order our bowls of cereal. I'd recommend getting the combinations they already have on the chalkboard wall, but to each his/her own!You basically customize your breakfast bowl - size, type of cereal, toppings, and choice of milk. They offer non-traditional milks as well, such as almond, soy, and even a banana-flavored one. I didn't get a bowl since it was sort of pricey (4 quid for a normal-sized bowl). American cereals are on one side of the wall, and British cereals are on another. They also have display shelves with vintage cereal boxes, which were pretty cool to look at.Tl;dr - expensive cereal, but a novel place to check out.

vICqTqo81EVyVz0TbRIb1A.text: Came here by my sister's friend's introduction.  The wide variety of cereals and milk available enables for a plethora of combinations.  The atmosphere in the shop is cozy, and although there's only one or two staffs working there, they are friendly and helpful when I asked for recommendations and directions.  I took so many pictures with my sister there.  Definitely worth another visit if it wasn't for the distance I have to travel to get there from where I usually stay.

YQuf9bB5LwPBSOQtWLb73w.text: I know the concept of paying loads (£4+) for a bowl of cereal is silly.. but I still really wanted to check out Cereal Killers cafe and I'm not sorry I did! The decor is really cool, old school cereal boxes all over the walls and fridge-magnet style board menus to peruse whilst in the queue. There are so many options that the queue time barely feels like long enough to make a decision. I eventually had 'unicorn poop' which was a cereal cocktail of party rings, rice crispies, little marshmallows, sprinkles and a big dollop of marshmallow spread in the middle. And a little bottle of semi-skimmed milk, although you can swap that for loads of different flavours (chocolate, caramel etc.) It was truly delicious! When I went it was packed and there wasn't a huge choice for seats, I ended up at a table with my friends right next to the queue, which was a bit awkward as people kept gawking at our cereals whilst deciding themselves. If this place calmed down a bit then it would be a really lovely little kooky cafe for an all-american cereal treat. I had a lovely time and will come back if all the hype ever dies down!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Unicorn poop cereal cocktail

Hxl7krWwdfeGVq_nu1H47A.text: I'd see the queues for this tiny place and was put off, especially as a I saw the half term kids about in swarms but as my office is quite near I'd been past it at lunchtime a few times when it seemed fairly more quiet.My friend and I decided to lunch here dead on midday and were able to grab the last two seats in the window which was a result. The menu was great fun and we decide to opt for their cereal cocktails - I got the lion king (lion cereal/coco caramel shreddies/mars mix/caramel milk), certainly a lot sweeter than what I normally get for lunch.Although it may be the most expensive bowl of cereal you've had, it might be worth it if not just for the novelty but for the perfect instagram food porn pic.

HpbXMOGP3Ffs-82iRLiJ_w.text: Cereal Killer Cafe is pretty close to the station and was not hard to find. I'm travelling and this neighborhood had a completely different vibe from the central London I just became accustomed to. The cafe has a great underground/independent vibe and I loved it's quirks. The cereal menu is extremely diverse and flexible for dietary restrictions with signs for vegan and lactose options.My criticism comes from the extremely long wait time and poor hygiene. I was the first in line and I stood waiting for too long (at a cereal bar, believe it or not!) Apparently they (as in the ONE staff member) prioritize deliveries over the person who has been standing in front of them for 30 minutes. The place was also not very clean; the tables smelled of dirty rag and the cutlery was not washed well.If you are a princess (like myself) I recommend sucking it up, because (despite everything I've said) this cafe was a cool experience and I recommend trying it out on a day out with your friends!

Y8H8REqveaUqwcW5QHLmxw.text: I had heard about this little gem of a place from friends and was excited to try it. I was very disappointed to learn they were out Reese's peanut butter cereal but was told it was very popular which doesn't surprise me I drowned my sorrow in chocolate coco puffs with Reese's pieces and peanut butter chips. I will definitely being going again to get my cereal fix. Very cool decor and unique idea would definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

7C7QZvnsUFkJkTsAvQvEvQ.text: I felt like Home as i entered this small cafe. Its a bit pricey but absolutly worth it. The Stuff is very friendly and lives for this cafe it seems

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. I want to live there!

h7kYLI8yiQl0wTrEOXv3DA.text: I had been craving Berry Kix for some time and i finally got to get satiated. It was like reliving saturday mornings all over again. Hovering over a bowl of cereal with cartoons playing in the background. Awesome vibe. Could stay there all day.

B_R8DC7NJC8-kWF-nxn4iQ.text: Great little retro place on Brick lane, yes its a bit pretentious and yes its a bit ridiculous but who cares! Its fun a bit different and cheap! So many choices and great service! I loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

b16QhHTwCfo9RUZJ91J3aw.text: Such a cool atmosphere for all the 90's kids out there. Be sure to head down to the basement where you can eat your cereal on a bed and watch old VHS videos!

NYdmEXWRQFakfL6VIyAwkQ.text: Great place to have a bowl of cereal plus the added extras! Being surrounded by well known cereals, cereals that I never knew existed and cereals I devoured when I was a kid...I've been hit with nostalgia baby! So why the 3 stars? Don't get me wrong, I think the cafe is a great place! However, it was extremely busy and over crowded, the que was long, and we had difficulties finding seats. I understand that its out of the cafe's hands but what do you expect for such a fantastic place?

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

gLH5jcC58mwarrH3Tm5RMQ.text: I knew of Cereal Killer Cafe before my visit. I knew the name because of the media attention around Christmas. So I decided to check it out. Pricing would have this at 1 star. No matter how good the cereal is I just had a bad feeling when I left that I spent that much on a bowl of cereal. Location is great on Brick Lane and is very vibrant. People are friendly inside and overall vibe is one of fun and positivity.

S7W9-fQ4_vSH_EEcHk1HHw.text: Popped in for some cereal. Came out with more smiles on a dreary Tuesday. I still prefer the Camden interior and space but this original cafe is still very good. I really do like that it is a niche product and one that is interesting in providing fun first and foremost.

B_TSHN8_M7ktEbcIZomzQQ.text: YES. This place nails it. It is an awesome cereal cafe, everything you hope it will be it actually is. Basically, you can do whatever you want. They have about one hundred cereals, mostly American and British, but several from around the world. They have around 20 types of milk and non-dairy alternatives. And they also have about 25 toppings. Pick any and all cereals you want, pick your size, choose a milk type, and then add your toppings. Yes, you can mix and match cereals in one bowl. Or not. Up to you.Too overwhelmed by the infinite possibilities to pick? Then just choose one from their cereal cocktails. These are their suggestions of various combinations to try.Tried the "trife up your life" - rice krispies with jelly, whipped cream, fresh strawberries, hundreds and thousands served with custard milk. Oddly enough, it worked and wasn't too sweet. Even refreshing in a way! And the custard milk is definitely unique - it's like sweetened milk.In case that wasn't enough, they have all kinds of retro sodas, although I was sad they no longer have Tab. Was totally looking forward to that. Every flavor of poptart and if you want nothing sweet or sugary, then you can even just grab toast with any spread.Everyone's friendly. Totally fun vibe. Lots of old shows playing on the ancient tubes downstairs. When we were there, it was Clarissa Explains It All. Decorated with all the 80s and 90s paraphernalia. Prices are totally right.Love this place. Will be back!

CwGBUy2vpD9PwzjROfvTkA.text: Amazing amazing, hundreds of choice of cereal even milk!! Fabulous decorated with old childhood style objects! They name all the cereal set in a funny way like you are looking at the menus of cocktail. I had rainbow blahblah.., just love it! But, the lighting needs to be improved in basement, and the price is far away from an economy level. Can you imagine people spent £5 for a bowl of cereal?

JkM1IbuNpxMj14-7sh3Vnw.text: The place is so cute and fun. Its so expensice though, but it is worth going once just for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

lTNPqe8EJMZo-_xSTnCY5w.text: I was going through restaurants in London on Yelp and this one caught my eye and since we were staying within relative walking distance to this place, I thought we should check it out and it was one of the coolest places I've ever been to!!First off, being a 90s kid the decor and ambiance totally fit my vibe. And admittedly, cereal was my main breakfast of choice as a kid 90% of the time. So I felt like I was back in my childhood just being in the cafe. At the bottom level, they even have twin beds where you can enjoy your cereal, along with other cool retro artifacts. The possibilities of your cereal creation is endless! I decided to go with The Lion King since I'm a fan of the caramel/chocolate mix and it was delicious!!! The caramel milk used can be customized to your liking as well so I went with soy. Now, £4 for cereal is not exactly cheap but the experience was so worth it!

k2qFCIuE5TvkgoCeU3BrXA.text: Walking down for brick lane street we found this awesome bar. Is small inside, maybe there's something downstairs...but we stayed in the ground floor.It's not an usual breakfast bar, it's more like what you usually get at home for breakfast!! Milk with cereals! Every kind of cereals you can imagine!!We took a simple cappuccino and believe me, I'm Italian, that cappuccino made me forget the Italian one!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

dQ_6_W0ufNdlNrMXmzFXJw.text: Located inside Camden Market. It's a cafe where you just order cereal and milk. Domestic cereal was only 3 pounds and imported was 4 pounds. You can even get a super marshmallow cereal. They also sell freeze dried marshmallows for your cereal. Service was a bit slow for putting cereal and milk together. Fun concept. I know Vancouver last week had a one day pop up shop on this.

mKP_a-DIFtGMHQ68BV0lKA.text: slowest service. overpriced. got my order wrong. will never be back. will never recommend.

XfoR8ZE_Z40a-jVzFv9YrA.text: The media had a field day when it opened, with their criticism and whatever else. But I really don't understand why. It is a brilliant concept. Who doesn't love eating cereal for dinner?? Don't tell me you've never gotten in from work, put your PJs straight on, and served yourself the biggest bowl of cereal known to man for dinner because you can't be bothered to cook. And now you can enjoy cereal for dinner in a less antisocial kinda way! This place throws you back to the 90s, music and all. The guys that work there are super friendly and easy going. If you love cereal as much as I do then you need to get down there asap. Their list of cereals is extensive. Crazy extensive (and includes a few gluten free choices -yippee!). Then you've got toppings like strawberries, marshmallows, banana, chocolate drops and walnuts. Then you have all the milk (dairy and non-dairy) with the option to flavour your milk with chocolate, strawberry, vanilla and so on. Oh and I forgot to mention,  you can mix your cereals!! (We were rarely allowed to do that as kids...it was a treat!) Can you feel my excitement??? I love everything about it!In the end I went for a large bowl of Ricicles with marshmallows and strawberries, topped with strawberry rice milk (I actually got overwhelmed with the toppings and milk choices and forgot that I could mix cereals...nooooo)! No doubt about it, 5 stars. And to the haters? Get a life! (FYI the best way to do this is to start having breakfast for dinner - go on, have some fun).

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Gluten and dairy free: Ricicles, freeze dried marshmallows, strawberry and strawberry flavoured rice milk. What a treat!!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Wall art...made of cereal boxes.

sYGQjqenTTumGD6GBv-ufw.text: Possibly I am not the target market for this place.It just feels to me like it's really, really trying to hipster cool - by doing that reverse things of desperately trying to not to be trying!Food is OK as far as it goes, which isn't far.The location is cramped & the decor is, not surprisingly, not to my taste. I'm sure they have a particular clientele, but not for me.

WGM1rYrhlrobDUDKXgQEvQ.text: The ambiance here is definitely very fun. Decor and setting is enjoyable, and props for such a cool idea. The cereal is also delicious - I tried the krave hazelnut cereal with banana milk. However, I will say that it is a little overpriced and the staff seemed disinterested and a bit rude. I would still recommend it, however, for the experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Interior of Cereal Killer Cafe.

3URZeN5ynXAGnknOdhToAQ.text: In the half hour I spent standing in a line of just five people, I came up with a list of strategies that would have prevented this half hour wait:-all four staff members were wearing every hat (taking orders, running orders, bussing tables). There was a full five minutes where no one was at the counter. Divide and conquer blokes.-Invest the 20 minutes it would take to provide an up to date inventory each morning. Post that on social media, and in story. Every order in front of me included three strikes of items not being available and/or staff members spending valuable minutes to see whether they had something.-Spend half an hour reading up on the psychology of choice to drive your menu. Few choices provided with the above, accurate inventory will go a long way in making choices easier and customers satisfied.Premise is great, prices more than fair, but business model, or at least management at this location, will be detrimental.

Ef_c3ct0y_YARocGrM_iFQ.text: Cereal killer cafe is a super fun little shop, they have two full walls of cereal and "cereal cocktails". The guy behind the bar (Gavin) was fantastic and fun. He even gave us a couple kinder hippos to try because we've never seen them. Would absolutely come here again. The price is decent and the variety and customization is great!

zU2NpGNklzf12vt9e7JWRg.text: Couldn't have a better name because what I ate was really a sugar infused heart attack in a bowl!Reasons to go here: it's cool, it's quirky, it's colourful and fun! The cereal cocktails are interestingly put together - although I didn't love the one I chose I still think the concept is great.Reasons not to go here: to have weetabix with skimmed milk. Yes, that's what the person in front of me ordered. Why???? If you're going to spend £3+ on cereal don't be boring!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Sugar infused heart attack in a bowl + fluff & toast

A6s7fDnJFUtFEnGb8ZkJCA.text: The reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is mainly because of the service. As the staff member was pouring the cereal I ordered, I heard him tell his coworker that the cereal I ordered looked like shit. This cereal bar is a great concept but definitely not a place I would want to come back to.

ws2VUW-G-jGVmdvfO6bWGA.text: Snap, Crackle, and Pop! I'm in love with Cereal Killer Cafe on Brick Lane in Shoreditch. Everything about this place is just pure awesomeness! Not only is it an ultimate hipster heaven with a fun concept, it's also a time capsule to all kinds of good childhood nostalgia. And let's face it the walls of cereal boxes in all the colours of the rainbow just make you smile :) How it works is you start by choosing your cereal from dozens of choices ranging from classics like Captain Crunch, Apple Jacks, Coco Pops etc. to the more peculiar ones like Poppin' Pebbles in either a small, medium or large bowl. Then you choose your milk (there's like 20 different ones to choose from) and finally you choose your toppings. This will set you back about 4 pounds or so. Some people complain it's too expensive, but I say it's totally worth the experience!I ordered Lucky Charms with extra marshmallows and it was everything I wished it would be and more. So sugary and unhealthy and awesome! It was just a fun thing to do and I enjoyed it!On top of everything the staff is great or in the famous words of Tony the Tiger "they're g-r-r-r-e-a-t"!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Got milk for my Lucky Charms? ;)
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

cOMRFWchxh1AjKa3W-AFOA.text: Absolutely love this place!!!!Alright- I have to admit that this was probably the most expensive bowl of cereal I've ever had but it was so delicious!! And it's so much fun to do pick the different cereals and toppings you like.Tough decision but I picked the "double rainbow" one and was not disappointed. I felt like a kid again and smiled over every spoon with a blue froot loop on it- the only colour we don't have in the German froot loops.They have some cute little souvenirs (also pretty expensive) but I couldn't leave without taking a bottle of 'freeze dried cereal marshmallows' with me :-)

OAtscYoHjCW60kI3Htj01w.text: The place is small and service was not great, but the idea alone is fun! The food prep was good and prices not bad, too bad the owner and her helper were overwhelmed with customers. Try it for the fun if you have time but avoid busy meal times.

rDUAuEAnRGl6_KKz4Z5uxw.text: Before I came here I was pretty skeptical because of the obvious question: how good can cereal get? Especially when I'm not usually a fan of cereal...Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised. I came here on a Sunday morning at around 10 am and it seemed like we had just beat the crowd, since the line started getting long after we came. I wanted something light since I would be getting afternoon tea later that day, so I ended up going for a small bowl of Cheerios with almond milk and blueberries. They prepared my bowl right away, and I appreciated how they put the milk in a separate jar - I like pouring in my milk in smaller portions because I'm a slow eater and if I don't, the cereal gets soggy.What I ordered sounds simple enough, but it was surprisingly satisfying. I can't say it was anything special, but it was definitely a solid breakfast. I only wish they put more blueberries, especially since it's an extra cost - I expect to get more than 10 (if I even got that many...). Otherwise, I enjoyed my experience here (both the concept and vibe were awesome) and I recommend a visit here if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Small bowl of Cheerios, blueberries, and almond milk

AwrNJGxYaNb6Kpp8bwlniA.text: I'll admit that I was sucked into the hype for this place and decided that I must go while in London. I mean - the place just looks cool! When I got inside, the place smelled really odd. It was really hot and smelled kind of like milk (not in a good way though). I did love the way the place is decorated. It kind of makes it perfect for a photo-op, which is why I guess every single customer that enters is so wide-eyed and snapping photos like a crazy person. I felt a little bad for the people that worked there because they are probably in a million photos but I guess they are used to it? I did snap one or 2 pics, but I was discreet about it, ok?!Anyways, I got some cereal. It was nothing special really since you can get a whole box for like $2 in America. I'm not sure if it's available in the UK? I didn't know that people actually wanted to eat Poptarts and cereal like that. I thought it was just part of my parents doing a bad job. I didn't know that people actually added other toppings to cereal like chocolate pieces and such. That is just odd. They really do have a good variety of cereals - even some rare ones.It is interesting that they had different types of milk (almond, hazelnut, etc) but they are from the box so don't expect freshly squeezed ones. I was disappointed about the banana milk flavor because it was actually like just 5 slices of an actual banana that they cut up and put into the cereal. At least blend it into the milk or something.I think it's more about the experience and the novelty. It did bring back some nostalgia.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Behind the counter
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. OH's and Fruit Loops

PQCgPY2vbba_nO7k5sTFVA.text: If you just see it as cereal and perhaps just have a regular bowl of cereal it might be overpriced but the cocktail cereal menu was ok all things considered. Lovely, friendly and helpful staff - one of them offered to help us out the shop with our pram even though there were two of us.I had the marshmallow submarine - who knew a Twinkie would taste nice soggy from milk!Go at an unpopular time of day, I'd say, like we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cereal, milk and ice tea for the gentleman in the shot :(
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Close up - Twinkie, marshmallows, magic star and golden nuggets
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. I had the Marshmallow Submarine "cocktail" bowl

U2X7Ixv0dRVHXvMvjQhPQA.text: This place is AWESOME!!! As if breakfast for dinner wasn't good enough on its own, this place makes it even better!Dozens of kinds of cereal from the UK, USA, and all around the world combine with 30 kinds of milk for nearly endless combinations of cereal nirvana! If you're feeling adventurous, you can even mix and match cereals into a single bowl. Their professionally-trained cereal engineers have come up with a handful of cereal 'cocktails' with wild combinations of cereal, flavored milk, and sweet toppings.The ensuing rush of sugar and nostalgia are helped along by the retro music and cereal art all over the walls. There's a series of collector's edition cereals (think movie merchandise like Star Wars Cheerios) and some awesome mosaic portraits of famous serial killers Hannibal Lecter and Dexter made entirely out of cereal pieces. Prices were really reasonable, the staff was friendly and helpful (and clearly loved their job), and the ambiance was comfortable. I can't wait to go back again. With so many cereal combinations to try, that's gonna be soon so I can keep experimenting with the perfect blend. Next time I might come in pajamas too (just to complete the childhood breakfast experience)!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The Lion King special bowl. Chocolate and caramel heaven.
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The menu. Pick your cereal, pick your milk (many dairy free options), and pick your toppings.
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cereal wall art.

BpdK2UJxs0Prl4IBf9qB9A.text: This place is awesome and such a cool concept. So many cereals from the US and the UK, including ones that I hadn't even seen in the US since I was younger! Was lucky enough to visit on one of their less busy days (Friday morning...seems like it would be busy?), but heard the queue's get long. I had the Peanut Butter Jelly Time, so good with the strawberry milk! I forgo my lactose intolerance for a day to have this and it was so worth it. Seriously! The vibe inside is awesome and the staff is friendly and willing to help if you want to switch anything up in their pre-made "cocktails." Lots of vintage and retro memorabilia. Really enjoyed the Dexter "cereal" killer artwork on the wall. Definitely worth the trip out to Brick Lane!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Interior

EoGXDyQGdwmT-kdpbxHFjg.text: I was really surprised about this place and thought it would be overated but actually it is pretty good! All the 70' 80' kids will be delighted by all the collectibles  (from series or cartoons)Obviously you would come for a bowl of cereal of your choice and depending of the size of the bowl you choose, you could mix many of them. I had mine with warm milk and went for some chocolate  frosties and it was yummy. You can be more adventurous and try their already made mix or even ask for some suggestions. Small bowl is at 3£

LRBpr-QJAge9UWi9f9jNog.text: So much fun and nostalgic!  Loved all the 80's references and the cereal was of course delicious. Also had an amazing looking hot chocolate that was just as good. Friendly quick service that give you a old movie as a table marker after you order. Loved it and highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

_jHsr1Nk-zY17bAqXM_nyw.text: Hole in the wall, super vintage. The most amazing breakfast. Cookie dough pop tart was a game changer! I recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

sHjJEaxrM865W5cma7b6aQ.text: Such a great experience! Super fun environment and a delicious twist on everyday cereal. Probably one of the best parts of my trip. Would definitely recommend to a friend

FbUGvJpFiWW-aeoElyQP1A.text: The atmosphere was amazing! So much detail went in to planning out this place. The staff were friendly, helpful, and prompt. The combinations of cereal mixtures were clever and delicious! Thanks for the great meal/experience.

9neCTYFCh0Ra4MhRgu6vSw.text: Another good visit! This time with bf and his brother.  We decided to rock up for an afternoon snack at 4ish on a saturday. There were people in there but it wasn't too busy.Again friendly service.This time I went for blue waffle cocktail which was minion cereal, waffle cereal and blueberries with cinnamon milk. It was delishhhh. I can't get over how much I love this place - cheap dessert, always different and hits the spot for a sweet fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Blue waffle

pJbjEwZOY4B_TcWVX2l8sQ.text: My partner and I went out seeking a simple yet delightful breakfast on a gloomy Saturday morning.Came across the notorious cereal killer cafe and while expectations were high due to its fame, the reality was beyond disappointing. Firstly, took us about 15 minutes once sitting down to be attended. Once we were, had to wait another 10 for someone to take our order. Once ordered, we expected to wait a bit for two simple bowls of cereal with some milk (and a side of strawberries). Our expectations were surpassed by the painful 45 minute wait, for (again), 2 bowls of cereal (no drinks). Once the food arrived, my side of strawberries consisted of a single strawberry cleverly sliced into 5 bits. Additionally, the strawberries were drowned in a surprise portion of canned whipped cream (which to clarify, was never ordered).  Once we finished the food, we were eager to leave. Getting to the register, we noticed a mayhem of paper receipts scattered along the table. This was so difficult to sort out, that a line formed, as customers were asked to repeat their orders so they could pay. Overall, felt hard to justify a 45-minute wait for two bowls of cereal- and no, it was not too full (no lines or anything).They seemed to be training a few staff members on the occasion- I can definitely understand that may have been the cause of some confusion, and do not blame them or any particular staff members. Simply ask for more attention to be given to orders, as all other tables around us also seemed miffed at the waiting times.

aq8Eg1WeyxzOgrI1QyEOxA.text: My 16 year old daughter begged to come her. Admittedly it's a very interesting concept. It was fun inventive and creative. The location is a bit small which makes it feel Bohemian. That may be part of its lure and charm. They do  have an extensive selection of cereals. Their mixed recipes are interesting and milkshakes are gorgeous. They look like they were created by Hanna-Barbera. The bottom line: this is a great tourist stop but not likely a regular stop for locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

4-qwXmprXZshd2Cg6VWyAA.text: Went here on a hot/humid afternoon, no a/c means NOT that great.But everything else was awesome, we got the bowloccino and mint choco chipster.Since it was hot, the milk wasnt super ice cold (which i prefer) but the flavor was good.The basement was filled with Thundercats, Ducktales and Clarissa Explains it All.Very fun, Portland/Brooklyn like feel to it, most of Shoreditch is.

VJlCsVmnPcizqiRzic-XQg.text: This place is very cool to come see but the service this morning was horrible. There was only one guy working and had us wait for at least 20 minutes before we could order because he was collected dirty dishes. Finally when we ordered it took us at least 5 minutes. Then we waited another 10-15 minutes to get our food in which time he came back over to check our order was correct. I really wanted to love this place but to have a breakfast over an hour for cereal is beyond ridiculous. I could have walked to the store bought all the ingredients and get back to my house 2 times and have 10 more pounds in my pocket.

C02DA1kWOphWZRDz9aCTZw.text: Great concept !A lot of choice in a hype cosy café. It is hypsterish, but I consider it to be a must see in the Brick Lane's neighborhood...Around £3.50/£4 for a bowl though...

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

4Qx_MsS_lPWTuROusmjWAw.text: This place was like a dream come true. I really loved the atmosphere. I also loved the concept of combining different cereals! I got the shooty shooty bang bang which was ok. Unfortunately I like the concept of this place more than the cereal... but what you expect? It's cereal!

lkuFtHlSedGL3_GkPsMjNw.text: I'm not going to lie, I first heard about this place on the news, the Daily Mail were outraged that these two hipsters could dare to open up a cafe selling bowls of cereal for £4 in the 'poverty stricken' Tower Hamlets!Also, being from Belfast myself, I wanted to support the two boys from home who had started up this venture.The cafe is super cool and funky in an old fashioned way, with cereals from all over the world available and on display.We went along on a Sunday and despite that, it was still packed! I had the Lion King cereal. It was a small bowl, and it was pure delicious sugary e-number-y goodness, I loved it!My other half had nothing, as he was being a spoilsport and wouldn't pay the money, even though we were 'on holiday'!I enjoyed the experience.I have only taken a star off because I found the service a bit 'faffy' and slower than it should have been.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Menu board
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. This was AMAZING!!!

xUWAvadUHyrX1PifWoNSHg.text: It's an intriguing concept and great to embrace your inner child. They have 120 choices of cereal, from global to American to British, and it can be overwhelming to choose. They do have cereal cocktails though, which you can adjust to your tastes or just leave as is.We got a small Bowlacchino to split, which is Nesquick cereal, Coco Pops, Flake, espresso milk, and cafe curl (we subbed it for Twix mix). It was super, super sweet (like more sugar than I need in a lifetime), but like I said, an interesting experience. Definitely a dessert.Read more here: naturallycapricious.com/…

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. bowlacchino

YVlIuXP5shf8AKlIJ2xG3w.text: Fancy going somewhere filled with pure ridiculous  childhood nostalgia? In the cutural heart of London? Where two can dine for £7..?!Then welcome to cereal killer cafe.Cool hipster setting in Brick Lane. Check.Bubbly but uber chilled ambiance. Check.Poptarts, a mound of international cereal and mini bottles of milk flavours in assorted flavours. Check.I want to be a cereal killer when I grow up...!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Alex discovered the holy grail...of the kitchen cupboard...
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. A wall of glorious temptation.

uJL-fBY3h-d9I3FrTUibtg.text: We found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try (even though I was still full from breakfast). The place is small, but it has a big variety of cereal, national and imported. They also have their own little concoctions of cereals such as the unicorn poop, which was pretty sweet and colorful, as expected LOL. When I was done, I went downstairs to look for the restroom.. but I only found some more chairs and tables. They do not have a restroom, but they suggested to go to the business next door, which apparently is ok with people to go to the WC there. Cool concept, I just wish they had a restroom.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Unicorn poop

SpSgVUq4-K2fYb_1zD4sWQ.text: Cerealously cool.. I absolutely adore this place! Cute, kitschy, nostalgic and oh-so-very-hipster - but in the best kind of way! With around 120 cereals to chose from, you can mix, add and chose til your hearts content what you want in your bowl of amazing-ness that comes with an adorable mini milk bottle to pour in! I really love the whole concept of this place.Cannot wait to come back the next time I'm in London for my bowl of sugary goodness!

upMPdWLhcIV-RsQRWSVivA.text: I'd been wanting to bring my sweet-toothed boyfriend here for months since I saw my friend post a ridiculous picture of her "breakfast". We had looked at the menu online beforehand to get ourselves excited, but I have a rule about not choosing what to eat before you get to somewhere so I decided to wait and see the menu when I arrived. The only issue is there wasn't much of a menu at the actual cafe; they had a blackboard up with lots of combos but unless you knew what you were doing, it was very hard to know all the options. I made a rash decision to go for a ready made combo of the mint chocolate dish with a happy hippo on top just because I could (!) and my boyfriend chose a Lion inspired one. We got a Pop Tart on the side (obviously) and some sugar sweet berry Fanta. By the time we ate it was actually 12 midday, but this is probably a good thing considering the huge intake of sugar that we consumed in such a short period of time!The cafe isn't very big with limited seating so I imagine it gets lretty busy. Luckily we got a seat downstairs, surrounded by all the quirky cereal memorabilia which gives the place such a nice touch. It's very expensive breakfast, but definitely worth it for the experience. My main recommendation is to choose from the online menu beforehand.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Mint milk with my mint breaky and caramel with his!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Almost too much choice..

A1VHitiBz61D6G60wlf6oQ.text: Oooh this place gave me the biggest nostalgia hit I've had since finding reruns of Sister Sister on TV a few months ago! Someone must've spent a lifetime collecting all the 80s and 90s memorabilia on the walls - anyone else remember the plastic tiger-shaped bike reflectors from the Frosties packets?! And they even had Clarissa Explains It All showing on TV! And then there's the cereal. The menu reads like a dentist's worst nightmare, each item sweeter than the last. And SO much choice it's overwhelming: 100+ cereals, 20+ toppings, poptarts, toast and just when you think you've cracked it, even 20 types of milk. My inner monologue was in overdrive (do I want something chocolatey? woah is that Cinnabon cereal?! maybe I should get a fruity poptart to be healthy? pah who am I kidding, 'healthy'! hmm is chocolate milk too much?! etc etc).Luckily there's a queue for you to make up your mind, and probably change it ten times with each new cereal box you spot. It moves fairly speedily but took a good half hour for us on a Sunday at 11ish, and was longer when we left. The most amusing part was hearing snatches of everyone else's convo's as they passed the ever expanding queue through Brick Lane Market ('you mean these people are all waiting for CEREAL?!', 'what do you mean it ONLY sells cereal?', '£3.50 a BOWL?! Why don't they go round the corner to Tesco?').Yes, it's kinda ridiculous. And it's unnecessary, and unhealthy, and completely overhyped. But it's just so fun that I don't care. I had a medium bowl of Reese's Puffs, topped with crumbled Oreo cookies (at the server's suggestion) and semi-skimmed milk, with a blueberry poptart (that I defo didn't need) and a latte. I left feeling like I needed to brush my teeth and praying the sugar crash later wasn't too bad and probably with early onset diabetes - but damned if it didn't put the biggest smile on my face too :-D

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. nostalgia in a bowl :)

LIT1_bMXX-9olasAknrOVA.text: Thanks yelp for finding this gem. This is something that simply wouldn't be real back at home. I love this area..its fun and full of specialty shops and vintage material. This shop really hit the need for a fun breakfast! You have a few options for your cereal. You can either build your own (pick which cereal you want along with size and type of milk), and then add toppings for I think 40p per topping. The other option would be to pick one of their original mixes. They hsve a lot of options to pick from. You can sit upstairs if there is room, or go downstairs for more seating. I would suggest going elsewhere for coffee. They have a few old school tvs and posters there as well.  Loved it, thanks!

TX717XWszb4CH9PBInEkRw.text: I have to admit that I am really envious of the free publicity that this place got - I first heard about it in a newspaper article, and since my brother has quite a cocktail of cereal when he is at home, I decided that I might really enjoy coming here. Straight out I have to admit that the concept behind this place is awesome - a cafe devoted entirely to breakfast cereal. It certainly is a very hip concept, and I don't think I know of any place where you can actually order breakfast cereal for breakfast (though they do serve breakfast all day). While you can have a single serving of cereals, they also offer cocktails, namely a mix of different cereals, and of course they have coffee as well (though the coffee was okay, nothing hugely spectacular). However, I have to admit that there are a couple of areas where they fall down, and it isn't just the coffee. First of all they don't have a huge selection of juice. In fact I can't remember if they had any juice. Secondly, other than gluten free cornflakes, pretty much all of their cereals are the fancy, high in suger, types - this isn't a place you go for a healthy meal. While I loved the concept, I was quite disappointed that my brother, who was looking forward to a cocktail of cornflakes, rice bubbles, all bran, and wheat germ, ended up only having some gluten free cornflakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

lRX9i9fgXqMzTQX_qwajUA.text: Ahhh! This place was so nostalgic. From the 90s/2000s music that plays while you enjoy your cereal, the twin bed seating area with 90s/2000s style comforters, to the VHS tape that your bill comes in. I felt like I traveled back into my childhood walking into this cafe. It was such a cool experience! They have a whole wall of cereals for you to mix and match as well as a menu that has combinations for you to choose from with different flavored milks. They also offer a vegan menu with a lot of vegan options! I had a cereal cocktail that had a variety of peanut butter and chocolate cereals and banana milk. So yummy! It's such a unique cafe and is definitely worth a visit if you are in London!

0hXeX9P45K8m0k2pC_17AA.text: 3.5 stars The idea is real cool for everybody with a sweet tooth like me! Definitely gives you the 90s kids vibe! We had an air bnb right above this place (also a great area just to go out, plenty of bars and surrounding hangout spots). Different kiddy cereals and milk combinations win my heart BUT, dont be fooled. You won't be able to finish the large unless you are 1. drunk 2. stoned 3. maybe both. My bf, his brother and I had to roll our selves out of there, we didn't even finish our bowls. The hot chocolate wasn't that impressive tasting, looked great though for all you hard core peeps on the gram. I would love to have a Hey Arnold marathon there. The novelty is definitely worth the try.

KUFEokHcGjLhBWIFWe8S7w.text: I came to visit this place while I was traveling. Super cute and unique. Such nostalgic decor all around. Some of the table seating area is actually a twin bed you sit on! They have more than just cereal, they also serve fun cocktails as well. I got the PB and chocolate cereal that was super good and they give you a cute glass of milk with it. I came on a weekday night and there was no line and plenty of seating. Very cool place, I would recommend my friends who are visiting London to go!

nVcAWLq1E6roGruWA8veCw.text: This place is super cute and has a lot of american and british cereal options. I went about 30 minutes before closing and I guess they were tired because they forgot two of our toppings. I wouldn't recommend the drinks, but it's worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

a4uA56-UnT0JvuRHMo8dTw.text: DON'T GO HERE IF YOU HAVE A NUT ALLERGY! (read on for why) I went to Cereal Killer today around 3 PM with a large group (of seven). We didn't get to sit together but they found a smaller table for us in the back (fyi you can prob have six or seven on a longer table+bed in the back if you request/wait). Was surprised when my friends who had come in a group (of six) almost AN HOUR before me still hadn't ordered... After hearing about their 40 minute wait just to order, we quickly flagged down the waitress. It got quite crowded and we ended up waiting over an hour for 2 bowls of cereal and a maltshake. The staff also kept messing up everyone's orders (there were one new employee but still) so there were lots of negative/angry customer vibes. The worst part (even more so than wasting time waiting on an overpriced bowl of cereal) was when one of my friends in the other group had a severe nut allergy and they served her cereal bowl with NUTELLA. My friend had asked and clarified multiple times (like 7) if her cereal had nuts in it. Her server didn't even know exactly what was in the cereals (They have NO INGREDIENTS LIST on their menus).I understand that the cafe was busy when we got there and they tried to do their best to help her after the fact, but I was very disappointed and will not be recommending this location to anyone.In summary,- bad service/wait time to order and to get cereal (how long does this really take like cmon)!!- very crowded and cramped especially in the back - inattentive staff who were not careful enough regarding my friend's NUT ALLERGY (she could have almost died...)- cereal is very subpar, friend's maltshake had foam/no icecream or even milk

DzyRpjWjLDewrEMjzJzEoA.text: Came in on a hot day and felt pretty miserable eating because of it. Regardless the service was ok, maybe understaffed. We ordered the cinnamon toast mozzarella sticks and the Lon don done. I thought the mozzarella sticks were delicious and I would highly recommend them if you like mozzarella! The Lon don done was good but nothing special in my opinion. The decor was very fun! Very 90's and it was a flash from the past. And the location is interesting to explore! I wouldn't want to come here on a regular basis but bring my friends to see when they visit because it's a pretty cool idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

bNbAqAYjOwD-e-GDjcpkEQ.text: Cute place, love the concept and the name. It can be a bit overwhelming with all the cereal choices but chances are, whatever your childhood favorite cereal was, they have it. I went with a bowl of fruity pebbles and fruit loops with marshmallows and strawberry milk. Made me feel like a kid again! It was a bit over 4 for the bowl. The place itself is tiny and the line moves slowly but definitely worth checking out if you are in the area. They also have hot chocolate and pop tarts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

O8rfcLs-tknbyahzMW0xgA.text: I left this place with a stomach full of disappointment and Cinnabon cereal (which, if by the end of this review you still feel compelled to go to this place, I highly recommend). The service here was the absolute WORST. It took an hour to get served, which if I had ordered filet mignon I'd be ok with. But no, I ordered a bowl of cereal. And not even a bowl of cereal and milk because the milk was served on the SIDE! HOW DOES IT TAKE THAT LONG TO PUT CEREAL IN A BOWL?! I wasn't alone in this, the people around me were experiencing the same slow service I was, we were all equally confused as to what could be going on in. Then I had to go to the bathroom (as one does from time to time) and was met with a roll of soggy toilet paper and water all over the floor. It was nauseating. While trying to pay and leave to finally let one of the parties waiting (way too long) in line a table, our waitress was MIA. We had to flag her down ourselves and hand her the money. The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars not 1 is because the cereal was tasty, but it was not worth it for the price or for the amount of time that was shed off my life clock waiting for these people to put cereal in a bowl in any kind of timely manner. NOT WORTH IT!! Just go to Sainsbury's. Less time, less money, dry toilet paper.

28FBbDSfVfQXWZhyx0srhw.text: Great concept. Poorly executed, order a lucky charm milkshake, took 15 mins (place was empty) warm milk no flavour stupidly priced,Don't recommend

FM-b5Ip2lo0nk6tqcqZmDg.text: Updating because I came back today after my first visit over 2 years ago and was disappointed in what a different experience I had. Expecting the same joyful, nostalgic, and somewhat self-aware hipster irony of spending 10 pounds on cereal, I arrived at cereal killer after a walk through the Columbia flower market. The staff were friendly and we were seated quickly and given the choice to pick one of the tables in the (pretty dimly lit) back room. We chose the table with the most light, underneath a wall of vintage cereal boxes. We were enjoying looking at all of the unique cereals until another waitress came and asked us to move because they actually needed to give the table to a larger party. Not a huge deal, and understandable, so we moved to the other table. Our waitress was very helpful in explaining some menu items (the menu has been updated since the last time I went). When our food came, the person who brought it put down our spoons- straight onto the bare table. I realize I'm extremely picky about this kind of thing but I really don't like silverware being put straight onto the surface of the table (which had crumbs from the previous guests still on it) as you never know what someone put on there last! After a few minutes when the waitress passed by, I asked her politely for another spoon. She stared at the spoons we already had and said "sure", never to return with a new one. Only when my friend went to the front counter to ask for spoons did we receive them! Though we had asked for some water which never came, the food itself was delicious as is expected of your favorite childhood cereals! Most of my disappointment came from the atmosphere/experience. They are trying to make it a sit down restaurant and have added savory options, which takes away from the fun simplicity of the idea in my opinion. What used to be such a fun, cute place now felt tired and old, with the cereal art pieces missing large chunks of Cheerios and a beanie baby wall that looked like about a third of them had fallen off.An example of the clientele/mood in the dining room- two girls were sitting at one of the tables taking photos. They had moved from their original table to this one because it had a bed with children's sheets as a bench. When the waitress came to ask them to please move so she could sit a party at that table, they said "one minute" and left the entire party standing there while they posed with cereal in multiple different configurations. Obviously to some extent everyone that goes to a place like this is going for the novelty or to take photos of their cereal creations to show friends how ~trendy~ they are and I am not one to talk on that front! But, i was disappointed in the lackluster experience after having such a great one on my first visit.EDIT: Also, no wifi:( and subpar restroom....

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Menu!

Rn9lYvmWtcX824Nm0f9oLg.text: I had not eaten a bowl of proper cereal in years. Decades actually.We were strolling down Brick Lane one fine Sunday morning and saw this fun restaurant. It was time!They had tons of choices but I went with something I had never heard of (that wasn't tough!) and added two kinds of fruit, strawberries and blueberries! With whole milk and a double espresso, I was in breakfast heaven! We ate downstairs, while sitting on kids beds watching old cartoons like Ninja Turtles and Thundercats on ancient TV's complete with built in VCR's!This was a strange time warp back to somebody's childhood. I'm sure that was the intent anyway! While enjoying our delicious breakfast, I noticed they had cereal boxes from all sorts of sources, including two with royals on them! Hilarious!We were energized and enjoyed the rest of the stay. Always start your day with a great breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Royalty!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Royalty!
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

P0wi20b_xmTt_xGPaVumuA.text: This was on my "must visit" list, when visiting London. I'm not going to lie, I felt a little bit overwhelmed knowing I had one bowl to create and all of those cereals to choose from. I would go back here everyday and try new combinations of things, if I could afford it. The bowls are a little pricey, but worth the crazy combinations you can come up with there. I decided to go with my own version of Unicorn Poop: Lucky Charms, Party Rings, Marshmallows, Fluff, Hundreds and Thousands, with Almond Milk. I am extremely sassy that this was never an option for me to eat this in the morning as a child. I would have loved waking up in the mornings before school and my mom would have dreaded the sugar-high.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

o9L82GVobmFB5-SByuvqtA.text: Wow. This place is awful. Probably the worst service imaginable. It took us well over 1 hour to get our coffees and cereals. For two people! The wait staff have no idea what they are doing. This place is a joke. Just avoid it. If you want an Instagram of a bowl of cereal, just take it at home!

iCqnHC9uKs5QBTjLa9r4tg.text: I lived in London for three months and the Cereal Killer Cafe was recommended to me several times before I left. I knew I had to go and had passed it a few times on the way to work but never really had the desire to walk in since cereal wasn't my top choice for a meal. The vibe of the place was pretty cool but I think the spot is overrated. The employees were very nice but the service was extremely slow and what i thought was going to be an in-and-out turned into a 30 minute wait for a bowl of cereal. I'd say this place is perfect for tourists who have some time to kill, but if you're in a hurry, maybe just come for the pictures. Overall, the restaurant is really cool and definitely Instagram worthy but the cereal wasn't as interesting as I expected it to be. Make sure you have other meals lined up for your day if you choose to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The inside wall of Cereal Killer Cafe in Shoreditch

X33vOsPktvIIznO9mSHv5Q.text: My friend was showing our mutual friend and I around as it was our first visit to London. She wanted to introduce us to the infamous salt beef at the two beigel stores on brick lane. It was late at night and I, for some reason, decided to just look to my left and there it was, like a calling from the heavens, a restaurant with every cereal box you can ever imagine. "Oh my, I forgot to tell you. This place is known for their cereal and sweet treats," my friend exclaimed.My jaw dropped when I made eye contact with it. I haven't had a bowl of cereal in ages, let alone this specific one. There it was...OREO O'S. Yes. For everyone who doesn't live in South Korea, the only country that still makes them, this is something we haven't seen in about a decade. I wanted to just jump through the window and hold the box because I thought I was hallucinating. They were closing up and I asked if they sold cereal by the box. Unfortunately they don't, especially because the O's are a rarity and very hard to obtain.We were engulfing on the rest of our Eurotrip the next morning and returned to London for the last day. I made it a goal of mine to indulge in a bowl before we headed back to the states.Fast forward 5 days later to the morning of our flight...We were short on time, but my friend and I were on a mission to buy salt beef and Oreo O's respectively. We made it to brick lane with minutes to spare. The line at Cereal Killer was taking forever with only about 5 people in front. Can't blame them because there are so many combinations of cereal, milk, toppings, milkshakes, poptarts, and other sweet delicacies. I, however, knew what I wanted. Simply a large bowl with Oreo O's and regular milk. I wanted to feel like a kid again! My turn was up and I placed my order. The guy at the register was ridiculously kind and told me that they may be opening up shop in my home, NYC! BEST NEWS EVER!!!!! Hopefully it happens.My bowl and milk arrived and I was really childish about it - jumping in my seat and all. 10 years later and I'm finally reunited with an former lover. What made it even more meaningful was that I recieved the second to last serving of O's! It was meant to be! What a romantic story, eh?! They put crumbled oreos in the bowl as well. I'm not complaining! But the first bite was so satisfying. I had to rush through the bowl because we were really short on time. I was happy to say the least. The large bowl of just Oreo O's was 6.95 pounds, I believe. High price because it is rare. Overall the other prices aren't TOO expensive, but for cereal it is. You do get your money's worth and it revives the kid in you. The bowls are small, medium, and large. I am definitely going here a few times during my next trip to London and I highly recommend it to anyone in town. This is a MUST VISIT!Also.. shoutout to the ninja team in Brick Lane! You guys are awesome! Thank you for the service!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Just a sample of all cereals they have
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Because 1 picture isn't enough: OREO O'S
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. OREO O'S

9S6kcPun1rTs7tXJPnYQ1A.text: After researching must visit places before heading to London we found this unique spot. And damn and I'm glad we visited. The inside is walled with hundred of cereals and serial killer art...made of cereal, obviously. I had a bowl of the Lion King and it was so chocolately delicious. Also, a side of pop tarts which took us back to our youth. We finished it off with a peanut butter hot chocolate which finally overdosed us on chocolate.If you're looking for something unique, this place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Storefront
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate!

Jm1uKFq-SPsxmBjvPHuUiA.text: This place has such a douchebag waitress. Just because we wanted to try one cereal doesn't mean you can be mean to us. I get that we're Asian and less privileged. Definitely regretted visiting here and plus such a overpriced place. Don't visit. Just take pics from outside.

8Qvp2BS4GXm_38vIuUNfTg.text: THIS PLACE IS CEREAL HEAVEN! I experienced Nostalgia at Cereal Killer Cafe! This place is fantastic with a wide selection regarding cereal and anything sweet! I had the frosted flakes and hot chocolate with brownies! The top floor is really cool with all types of cereal hanging on the wall. But the downstairs is even cooler taking it back to the 90's. This place had old Vcr's, animations/music from the 90's & even a throwback posters of Nsync! This place needs 5 STARS because it's iterally the coolest place in Shoreditch!

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom

UD4_rWkbphmLAijfR4_4uw.text: I love it! Back to the 90's and childhood. They have a large choice of cereals. It gets a little crowded sometimes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cereal Killer Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cereal killer

OmieB61Tlwx3W68l6jK7nQ.text: This place is one of the best places I've ever eaten at! The staff is amazing - not many places will seat a group of 25 american's 15 minutes before closing time - the atmosphere is one of a kind, and I think it's almost impossible to not enjoy every second of time spent here. I will definitely be back, Cereal Killer Cafe!!
